wikipedia_page.main: Arthur William Fulcher (7 May 1855 – 17 May 1932) was an English yacht racer and cricketer.

response: Fulcher was born at Bearsted in Kent in 1890. His father, Arthur Fulcher, had played cricket for Kent and was a noted yachtsman and his eldest brother, Edward, played cricket for Devon and for Kent's Second XI. Fulcher was educated at Castlemount College in Dover and then at Radley College where he played cricket for the school in 1906 and 1907.Lewis P (2013) For Kent and Country, pp.180–181. Brighton: Reveille Press.  He scored over 350 runs and took 51 wickets in his final year at school, and was described as an "outstanding" fielder by Wisden.Carlaw D (2020) Kent County Cricketers A to Z. Part Two: 1919–1939, pp.84–85. (Available online at the Association of Cricket Statisticians and Historians. Retrieved 23 December 2020.)Fulcher, Capt. Eric Jesser, Obituaries in 1923, Wisden Cricketers' Almanack, 1924. Retrieved 23 December 2020. After leaving school he moved to Attleborough in Norfolk, farming and studying land management.
